TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
60 [Iohan ap.]
SEint Iohan þe ewangeli&slong;t Ewangelist &punctelev; þat Apo&slong;tel is
was o&rrot;e louerdes Aunte aunte sone &punctelev; and seint Iemes b&rrot;oþur iwis
his Moder moder was o&rrot;e lauedie su&slong;ter &punctelev; Marie cleophe Cleophe
Iwedded heo was to is fader &punctelev; þat hiet zebede Zebede
Þis Zebede hadde tweiȝe sones &punctelev; bi Marie is wif
Þes seint Iohan and eke seint Ieme &punctelev; þat ladden wel holi lijf
¶Seint Iohan was ȝonguo&rrot;e þane o&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; twelf monþe oþur þereaboute
Fo&rrot; is kun he was þe betere Man man
&punctelev; þarof nis no doute
And natheles he was ich wene &punctelev; þritti ȝer old neiȝh
Are hee ouȝt muche of o&rrot;e louerd wu&slong;te &punctelev; oþer are he him muche iseiȝh
Fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd nas bote lu&ydot;te iknowe &punctelev; ne he ne cudde him nouȝt
Are he ibaptized were &punctelev; and to cri&slong;tinedom ib&rrot;ouȝt
And ȝeot ne cudde he him nouȝt ab&rrot;od &punctelev; are seint Iohan þe bapti&slong;t were
Imartred fo&rrot; þe lawe of holie churche &punctelev; þat he gan heroudes lere
¶Ake þo seint Iohan imartred was &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd ne sparede nouȝht
Fo&rrot;to gon and p&rrot;echi aboute &punctelev; til he was to deþe ib&rrot;ouȝt
To beon is desciples fur&slong;t he ches &punctelev; tweiȝe b&rrot;eþren þo
Seint petre Petre and seint And&rrot;eu &punctelev; ase he cam bi þe se go
And þare he saiȝh tweie b&rrot;eþren þo &punctelev; seint Ieme and þes seint Iohan
with þe olde man Zebede &punctelev; heo&rrot;e fader afischeth gon
¶heom he cleopede also to him &punctelev; and hu&ydot; bilefden anon
heo&rrot;e fader and siweden him &punctelev; and token þe betere won
Seint Iohan was be&slong;t with him &punctelev; of is desciples echon
Þat was isene þo he leonede &punctelev; and slep opon is b&rrot;eo&slong;tebon
Fo&rrot; þe ȝwile he made is cene &punctelev; ase on schereþo&rrot;esda&ydot;
Seint Iohan among is desciples &punctelev; to is swete b&rrot;e&slong;te la&ydot;
Amo&rrot;ewe ase on þe guode frida&ydot; &punctelev; ase he deide on þe rode
his swete moder and seint Iohan &punctelev; fa&slong;te bi him &slong;tode
Þere in seint Iohanes warde &punctelev; is swete moder he tok
To wardi ase hire owene sone &punctelev; ase we findez iwrite in bok
¶hire wardein he was aftur also &punctelev; þat he to heouene iwende
Al þe ȝw&ydot;le þat heo on eo&rrot;þe was &punctelev; fo&rrot;to he aftur hire sende
Riȝht it was to wardi hire &punctelev; ȝwane heo is Aunte aunte was
And fo&rrot; þare nas non oþur of heom &punctelev; þat clene ma&ydot;de was
Clene ma&ydot;de to wardi oþur &punctelev; riȝht it was ido
Þarefo&rrot;e in is swete warde &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd bitok hire so
Aftur þat o&rrot;e louerd was &punctelev; to þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene iwent
And his desciples awitsonenda&ydot; &punctelev; þene holi go&slong;t hadde isent
¶hu&ydot; wenden fo&rrot;th wel baldeliche &punctelev; euerech in is side
Aboute in diuerse londes &punctelev; and p&rrot;echeden wel wide
Into þe londe of As&ydot;e &punctelev; seint Iohan þe ewangeli&slong;t Ewangelist
wende to wissi þulke side &punctelev; and p&rrot;echede of Iesu cri&slong;t Crist
To þe Cite cite of Efese &punctelev; atþe la&slong;te he com
Þare he hadde himsulue hous and hom &punctelev; and p&rrot;echede cri&slong;tindom
¶Þe Aumperour domician Domician &punctelev; þat luþur was inovȝh
Alle þe cri&slong;tine Men men þat he fond &punctelev; he to&rrot;mentede oþur aslouȝh
So þat seint Iohan was inome &punctelev; þat longue hadde beo isouȝht
Bifo&rrot;e þe Aumpero&rrot;es Iu&slong;tise iustise
&punctelev; ful sone[al. to
rome Rome ] he was ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þe Iu&slong;tise iustise þouȝhte anon &punctelev; fram god God to tu&ydot;rne is þouȝht
Certes quath þis holie Man man
&punctelev; þareto ne b&rrot;inge&slong;t þou it nouȝt
Fo&rrot; ichulle mo&rrot;e don after god God &punctelev; þane aftur þe iwis
Welle wrothþ was þe Iu&slong;tise iustise &punctelev; þo he iheo&rrot;de þis
Ane tonne ful of Eo&ydot;le eoyle he nam &punctelev; and liet it bo&ydot;lie fa&slong;te
And al wallinde þesne holie Man man &punctelev; amidde þe eolie he ca&slong;te
¶Seint Iohan þareinne sat &punctelev; so longue so it was
he ne chaungede neuer ene his hiev &punctelev; ne neuere þe wo&rrot;se him nas
Ake al hol withouten eni harm &punctelev; out of þis eol&ydot;e he aros
Þe Iu&slong;tise iustise þat him þerinne b&rrot;ouȝte &punctelev; þarof wel so&rrot;e agros
Þis was in rome Rome bifo&rrot;e a ȝat &punctelev; þat þis dede was ido
Þat men cleopeden þe po&rrot;te latin &punctelev; and ȝu&ydot;t men doth also
Aseint Iohanes da&ydot; it was &punctelev; in þe biginningue of ma&ydot;
Fo&rrot; þulke miracle men holdez ȝu&ydot;t &punctelev; þo&rrot;u al þe lond is da&ydot;
And fo&rrot; þat ȝat hiet po&rrot;te lat&ydot;n" &punctelev; þare þe dede was ido
Ȝu&ydot;[t] men holdeth þilke da&ydot; &punctelev; of seint Iohan also
¶Domician þe Aumperour &punctelev; þo he isaiȝh þis cas
Þat seint Iohan nas noþe wo&rrot;se &punctelev; þat he in þe eolie was
wodwroth he was and so&rrot;i inouȝh &punctelev; ake natheles he ne do&rrot;&slong;te nouȝt
Fo&rrot; cri&slong;tine Men men þat he were &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ him to deþe ib&rrot;ouȝht
he hiet him fleo out of þe londe &punctelev; þat non mo&rrot;e he ne come þere
Iharled he was out of rome Rome &punctelev; ase þei he &slong;trong þeof were
And ioutlawed ase a þeof &punctelev; þat he in þe contre&ydot;e ne come
Into þe &ydot;le of patmos &punctelev; he wende out of rome Rome
And wonede þare in penaunce &punctelev; twelf monþes neiȝh
Of o&rrot;e louerdes p&rrot;iuetez &punctelev; wel muche he þare iseiȝh
Fo&rrot; ofte þe p&rrot;iuetez of heouene &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd him schewede þere
Ȝwareof he made þare ane bok &punctelev; alholi churche to lere
þat men cleopeth Apocalips &punctelev; þat men redez in churche al da&ydot;
Muche is of gode&slong; Godes p&rrot;iuetez &punctelev; þat he þare isaiȝ[o&rrot;ig. i saiȝh]
¶Þe fur&slong;te ȝer þat seint Iohan: þus ioutlawed was
Of þe Aumperour þat him d&rrot;of awe&ydot; &punctelev; þare bifeol a so&rrot;i cas
Fo&rrot; þe senatour him aslovȝ &punctelev; þat was þo of
rome Rome
In contek þat heom was bitwene &punctelev; fo&rrot; hu&ydot; conteckeden ilome
Seint Iones pa&ydot;s was sone icried &punctelev; and alle oþeres also
Þat weren þo&rrot;uȝ þe Aumperour &punctelev; in outlawingue ido
Seint Iohan him wende aȝeinward þo &punctelev; mildeliche inovȝ
Toward þe cite of Efese &punctelev; to is owene hous he d&rrot;ouȝ
Fo&rrot; he hadde þare hous and hom &punctelev; and kun and freond inowe
Men and wimmen of þe toun &punctelev; wel þicke aȝein him d&rrot;owe
To welcomien him with grete Io&ydot;e ioye &punctelev; and into toune him b&rrot;ouȝte
with swiþe gret p&rrot;ocession &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; ful wel ouȝten
¶Ase hu&ydot; wenden þo&rrot;uȝ þe toun &punctelev; with grete Io&ydot;e ioye þere
Men and wimmen aȝein heom comen &punctelev; with ful d&rrot;eo&rrot;ie chere
Fo&rrot; d&rrot;usiane a ded womman &punctelev; toward vrþe hu&ydot; bere
Þare was fo&rrot; hire deol inovȝ &punctelev; and wel so&rrot;ie alle hu&ydot; were
Gret loue þare hadde er ibeo &punctelev; bitweone hire and seint Iohan
Ase sone ase þat folk him isaiȝ &punctelev; þe gladdo&rrot;e alle hu&ydot; were anon
hu&ydot; gonne on him to crie fa&slong;te &punctelev; sire hu&ydot; seiden þin o&rrot;e
Þis is d&rrot;usiane Drusiane þi guode freond &punctelev; þat was vnder þi lo&rrot;e
Þou wo&slong;t wel heo hath þe muche iloued &punctelev; nov ne ma&ydot; heo nonmo&rrot;e
here heo is in þis bere ded &punctelev; heo makez us carie so&rrot;e
¶Heo ne wilnede non oþur þing &punctelev; þe ȝwile heo sik la&ydot;
Bote þat he[= heo] mo&slong;te þe iseon &punctelev; are hire endeda&ydot;
And nouþe it is so ase þou sixt &punctelev; þat þei þou beo here heo ne ma&ydot;
Þench on þe loue þat heo þe louede &punctelev; sethþe heo þe fur&slong;t isa&ydot;
And ȝif þou wolde&slong;t us swuch grace do &punctelev; and aȝein to liue hire b&rrot;ingue
Euere we scholden herie þe &punctelev; and þe kingue of alle k&ydot;ngue
¶seint Iohan bigan to sichen so&rrot;e &punctelev; ase he in þouȝhte were
he bad heom ane &slong;tounde abide &punctelev; and setten adoun þe bere
he sat adoun wel softe akneo &punctelev; and criede to o&rrot;e louerd þere
Þis woman þat him so muche louede &punctelev; ȝif it were is wille arere
Þo he hadde iseid is o&rrot;esun &punctelev; anonriȝht in þe place
Þis womman aros up hol and sound &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerdes grace
And herede fa&slong;te ihesu cri&slong;t Crist
&punctelev; and þene holie man sein Iohan
Þare was p&rrot;ece of alle þe men &punctelev; þat þudere miȝhten gon
Seint Iohan bad hire go hom anon &punctelev; and gre&ydot;þi somþing to mete
Athom in hire owene hous &punctelev; þat he miȝhte with hire ete
¶Þeos d&rrot;usiane Drusiane wente fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and ȝa[r]kede mete inovȝ
And made seint Iohan fair semblaunt &punctelev; and elles it were wouȝ
[fol. not numbered]In þe cite of Efese &punctelev; seint Iohan bilefde longue
And p&rrot;echede þat folk to gode tu&ydot;rne &punctelev; and cri&slong;tindom afongue
And o&rrot;deinede p&rrot;eo&slong;tes &punctelev; and churchene liet arere
Bischopes he made be&slong;te Men men &punctelev; þat folk fo&rrot;to lere
Þis guode Men men þat vnder him weren &punctelev; bischopes and oþere also
Fondeden boþe niȝht and da&ydot; &punctelev; aftur is wissingue do
hu&ydot; crieden on him with al ho&rrot;e miȝhte &punctelev; alle of one[al. þe] cite
Fo&rrot; he wu&slong;te so muche and vnderȝat &punctelev; of o&rrot;e louerdes p&rrot;iuete
Þe ȝwile he with him on eo&rrot;þe was &punctelev; and next him euere also
Þat he scholde of is holie lijf &punctelev; in sum guode bok do
And of is ku&ydot;nde ȝwat he was &punctelev; and þat folk don to lo&rrot;e
Þat hu&ydot; miȝhten þe betere iwite &punctelev; ȝwat o&rrot;e swete louerd wo&rrot;e
¶Seint Iohan bisouȝte þat folk ȝeo&rrot;ne &punctelev; fo&rrot; him þat hu&ydot; bede
In fa&slong;tingue and in o&rrot;isones &punctelev; to don a swuch holi dede
And wende into a derne &slong;tude &punctelev; and bad o&rrot;e louerd fa&slong;te
Þat he scholde þene holie go&slong;t &punctelev; into is heo&rrot;te ca&slong;te
Þe holie Godspel of him to make &punctelev; alholie churche to lere
Ȝwareþo&rrot;uȝ euerech cri&slong;tine man &punctelev; þe betere bilieued were
he bad also þat þare ne scholde &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerdes grace
wind. ne re&ydot;n. ne oþur weder &punctelev; come neiȝhim in þat place
To letten him of is holie dede &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le he þareaboute were
Ore louerd heo&rrot;de is bone wel &punctelev; þat no weder ne lette him þere
Ne cam no w&ydot;nd ȝeot to þis da&ydot; &punctelev; ase þe holie Man man it bad
Ne oþur tempe&slong;te in þulke &slong;tude &punctelev; as þe bok was imad[al. a v. mo&rrot;e: Holi is þe bok when so holi is þe &slong;tede]
Ne miȝhte neuereft come tempe&slong;te &punctelev; ase þe holie man it bad.[hadde ibede]
Anon so seint Ion bigan &punctelev; to don þis holie dede
Itend he was of þe holie go&slong;t &punctelev; þat ech del þat he seide
he sek of o&rrot;e louerdes b&rrot;eo&slong;te &punctelev; ase he þarto la&ydot;
Þe ȝwile he made is swete cene &punctelev; aschereþo&rrot;esda&ydot;
Þare he sek out þat holie wit &punctelev; of þe holie godspelle
Þat he made sethþe in Efese &punctelev; among cri&slong;tine Men men to telle
he was þe feo&rrot;þe Ewangeli&slong;t &punctelev; and herre nas þare non
And is godspel he made la&slong;t &punctelev; of heom euerechon
Seint Matheu and seint Mark/ &punctelev; and eke seint luc Luc iwis
heo&rrot;e godspelles hu&ydot; hadden longue imaud &punctelev; are he biguonne his
Ake seint Iohan bigan his hext &punctelev; fo&rrot; þareon he bigan
Of o&rrot;e louerd al ȝwat he was &punctelev; are þat he were Man man
he bigan so heiȝe is godspel[MS. godspell] &punctelev; of o&rrot;e louerdes ku&ydot;nde iwis
Þat vnneþe ani Man man eo&rrot;þelich &punctelev; entendeth ȝwat it is
Fo&rrot; he souȝhte so deope is ku&ydot;nde &punctelev; and of him bigan so heiȝe
In þe fourme of Ane ane
Ern ern he is depeint &punctelev; ase we ofte iseoth with eiȝe
Fo&rrot; þe Ern ern is swifte&slong;t[r. sucth (= seoth) be&slong;t] of alle foules &punctelev; and hext he ma&ydot; fleo
Fo&rrot; ȝwane he is in þe lofte an heiȝh &punctelev; þat herre ne ma&ydot; non beo
Ȝu&ydot;t he ma&ydot; here in þe grounde &punctelev; ane luttle wo&rrot;m iseo[al. a v. mo&rrot;e &punctelev; & ate segronde a smal fisch &punctelev; to chese wider to teo.]
Also he ma&ydot; so heiȝe fleo &punctelev; and þe firmament so neiȝh
Þat alme&slong;t is w&ydot;ngene b&rrot;enneth &punctelev; ȝwane he is so heiȝh
¶Se[al. Seint (Se)] Iohan þat is þe fourme of Ern ern &punctelev; is godspelles wel heiȝe bigan
Þareinne he tolde al is lif &punctelev; þe ȝwile he was on eo&rrot;þ man
his godspel is swiþe heiȝ iholde &punctelev; ase wel riȝht it is
Fo&rrot; muche del of holi churche &punctelev; þerþo&rrot;uȝh iloked is
Seint Iohan cudde þis godspel sone &punctelev; and p&rrot;echede it fa&slong;te also
Ȝeot þare weren luþere men &punctelev; þat onde hadden þareto.
¶On at&ydot;me manie luþere Men men &punctelev; togadere heom hadden inome
And to seint Iohan þe ewangeli&slong;t Ewangelist &punctelev; in grete wrathþe come
And heten him wende fo&rrot;th with heom &punctelev; to heo&rrot;e maumates a non
And anouri as fo&rrot;th with heom &punctelev; oþur it scholde anoþur gon
Beu freres quath þis holie Man man &punctelev; ichulle segge eou a sothþ
Ich habbe reuþe of eov in mine heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þat ȝe nutez ȝwat ȝe dothþ
Ichulle don eou chois of twei&ydot; þingues &punctelev; and þarof cheose ȝe
To gon with eou to eower temple &punctelev; oþur ȝe to churche with me
¶Ȝwane Ȝe to gode&slong; Godes churche comieth &punctelev; ȝif ȝe þo&rrot;uȝ eower gode&slong; Godes lawe
Mouwen make þe churche to falle &punctelev; bilieue ichulle on heom fawe
And ȝif ich ma&ydot; bi eower temple &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e eower owene siȝhte
Bileueth on Ihesu cri&slong;t Crist ich rede &punctelev; ȝwane ȝe iseothþ is miȝhte
We grauntiez wel þis oþure seiden &punctelev; þou schalt fur&slong;t bigu&ydot;nne
To cu&ydot;þe þine louerdes miȝhte &punctelev; þe mai&slong;trie fo&rrot;to w&ydot;nne
To þe false temple hu&ydot; wenden fur&slong;t &punctelev; and þo hu&ydot; weren þareneiȝh alle
Seint Iohan bad heom &slong;tonde fer &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; ne weren offalle
¶Þo hu&ydot; weren alle withd&rrot;awen afeo&rrot; &punctelev; seint Iohan afeo&rrot; &slong;tod
Iseo ȝe he seide þis temple alle &punctelev; þat ȝe holdeth so guod
Ich hote hire in mine louerdes name &punctelev; þat heo falle anon
Þat ȝe mowen þe soþe iseon &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e eou here echon
Ne hadde he bote þat wo&rrot;d iseid &punctelev; þat heo ne ful up þe doun
Fram ende to oþur al þis temple &punctelev; with swiþe grislich soun
¶Þo al þat folk þat þare &slong;tod &punctelev; þis miracle iseiȝh
hu&ydot; gonne to crien on Ihesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; and on seint Iohan an heiȝh
Twelf þousend Men men þare to&rrot;neden &punctelev; echone to cri&slong;tindom
withoute child&rrot;en and wimmen &punctelev; þat turneden also mani on
¶ ARi&slong;todimus Aristodimus þe Bischop &punctelev; and Mai&slong;ter maister of þe lawe
Ȝu&ydot;t ne miȝhte nouȝht seint Iohan &punctelev; to o&rrot;e louerd is herte d&rrot;awe
Fo&rrot; þo he isaiȝh þis faire miracle &punctelev; þat þe temple ful so þere
Ȝeot nolde he it nouȝht ileue &punctelev; þat ani miracle it were
he nolde ilieue in none manere &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd were of miȝhte
Seint Iohan &slong;tod and þouȝhte longue &punctelev; hou he him miȝhte b&rrot;ingue be&slong;t to riȝhte
¶And seide "seiȝe þou me ȝwat i schal do &punctelev; þat þou bifo&rrot;e þe iseo
And bote ȝif ich it do ne lief þou nouȝht &punctelev; þat mi louerd almiȝhti beo
Par fe&ydot; quath þis luþere Man man &punctelev; nov ichulle herkni þe
Do nouþe þat ichulle þe segge &punctelev; and þou schalt winne me
Venim ich habbe &slong;trong inovȝh &punctelev; þat hoso þarof nimeth ouȝt
Ne come þere withinne him neuere so lu&ydot;te &punctelev; to deþe he wo&rrot;thþ ib&rrot;ouȝt
[This verse is doubled in the MS.]Drink þareof bifo&rrot;e[MS. b &punctelev; atfo&rrot;e] mine e&ydot;ene[E&ydot;ȝen] &punctelev; and ȝif it ne greueth[greuez] þe nouȝht
To Ihesu cri&slong;t Crist þat is þi god God
&punctelev; ichulle take al mi þouȝht
Þou sei&slong;t wel inouȝ quath seint Iohan &punctelev; b&rrot;ing nouþe hidere to me
Þat &slong;trongue ven&ydot;m and ichulle &punctelev; hit d&rrot;inke bifo&rrot;e þe
¶Þe false Bischop bischop him biþouȝthe &punctelev; fo&rrot;to aga&slong;ten him þe sarro&rrot;e þere
And also to seon þe soþe &punctelev; þat his god God of pouwer were
Twe&ydot; men þare weren to deþe idempt &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e luþere dede
Þe false bischop dude hem boþe &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e seint Iohan lede
And made heom d&rrot;inke of þat ven&ydot;m &punctelev; riȝth bifo&rrot;e is e&ydot;ȝe
Anon so it ouȝt withinne hem cam &punctelev; boþe hu&ydot; gonne de&ydot;ȝe
¶Seint Iohan sethþe þe coppe tok &punctelev; þo he isaiȝh al þis cas
And d&rrot;onk þareof ane grete d&rrot;auȝt &punctelev; and neuere þe wo&rrot;se him nas
Ake euere þe lengo&rrot;e þareafturward &punctelev; þe mo&rrot;e Io&ydot;e ioye he made and blis
Þat folk &slong;tod al in gret wonder &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; iseiȝen al þis
¶hu&ydot; &slong;toden and biheolden sein Iohan longue &punctelev; þre tidene and mo&rrot;e
And euere þe leng þe gladdo&rrot;e &punctelev; hu&ydot; seiȝen him fo&rrot; al his so&rrot;e
To Ie[s]u cri&slong;t Crist hu&ydot; gonne tu&ydot;rne &punctelev; and criden merci anon
So þat hu&ydot; to cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; þare turnde wel man&ydot; on
¶Ake Ari&slong;tod[i]mus þe Bischop bischop &punctelev; was euere in luþere þouȝte
And ne biliefde nouȝht in Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; fo&rrot; al þat he þare wrouȝte
Ȝwat fa&ydot;llez þe ȝu&ydot;t quath seint Iohan &punctelev; me þunchez it is with wouȝh
Þat þou ne leue&slong;t o&rrot;e louerdes miȝhte &punctelev; ne sixt þou nouȝt ȝu&ydot;t inovȝ[This v. on the margin.]
Bote þou mo&slong;t ȝu&ydot;t quath þe Bischop bischop &punctelev; þe dede to liue arere
Þat to deþe with þis ven&ydot;m &punctelev; apo&ydot;soned nou riȝht were
Þou sei&slong;t nouþe ful wel quath seint Iohan &punctelev; ake þat þou þe soþe iseo
Inelle nouȝt misulf ne&ydot; him hem come &punctelev; ake ope þe it schal al beo
Nim mine cu&ydot;rtel here to þe &punctelev; and leiȝe ope hem anon[MS. anom]
And in þe name of Iesu cri&slong;t Crist
&punctelev; hot heom arise a[nd][MS. a] gon
¶Þe bischop nam seint Iohanes
Cu&ydot;rtel cuyrtel &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e riȝht þe Iu&slong;tise iustise
And leide ope þe dede and het heom þo &punctelev; in o&rrot;e louerdes name arise
Anon so he hadde þis wo&rrot;d iseid &punctelev; þis men arisen anon
And ȝeoden fo&rrot;th hole and sounde &punctelev; and þonkeden seint Iohan
¶Þe bischop þo he þis iseiȝh &punctelev; and þe Iu&slong;tise iustise also
Criden merci Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; of þat hu&ydot; hadden misdo
And to&rrot;neden þare to cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; and oþur folk also inouȝh
Fo&rrot; þe faire miracle þat hu&ydot; se&ydot;en &punctelev; and elles it were wouȝh.
¶Þe Miracle þat seint Iohan dude &punctelev; no toungue telle ne ma&ydot;ȝ
Þarefo&rrot;e folk him siwede fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat is miracle isa&ydot;ȝ
Twe&ydot;e Ioliue louerdingues and wilde &punctelev; þat ȝoungue and Ioliue were
Siweden him and duden also &punctelev; ase he gan heom lere
¶Fur&slong;t hu&ydot; solden al heo&rrot;e god &punctelev; þat heom ne bilefde nouȝth
And turnden hem al to Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; heo&rrot;e heo&rrot;te and al heo&rrot;e þouȝht
And siweden[MS. siwenden] sein Iohan swiþe fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat þareto heom hadde ib&rrot;ouȝht
And he heom p&rrot;echede of Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat deo&rrot;e heom hadde ibouȝht
¶Þis tweiȝe ȝongue men ase hu&ydot; ȝeoden &punctelev; sw&ydot;þe riche men and heiȝe
with grete noble&ydot;e and p&rrot;u&ydot;de inouȝ &punctelev; bi þe we&ydot;e hu&ydot; seiȝe
Þouȝten hu&ydot; swuch noble&ydot;e &punctelev; we weren iwoned to lede
In Iolifte and in p&rrot;u&ydot;te inouȝ &punctelev; and nouþe we beoth in wrechhede
In Mise&ydot;se miseyse and in pouerte &punctelev; and riche weren bifo&rrot;e
vs þinkez so&rrot;ie mouwe we beon[MS. bieon] &punctelev; þat we euere weren ibo&rrot;e
Seint Iohan wu&slong;te al heo&rrot;e heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þei he ne heo&rrot;de þareof nouȝht
Ȝe foles he seide ȝwat is eou nouþe? &punctelev; ȝwi chaunge ȝe eouwer þouȝht
Bowes and ȝeo&rrot;dene fechchiez me &punctelev; and &slong;tones also
Þis ȝongue Men men weren þareaboute anon &punctelev; þat þe dede were ido
¶Seint Iohan to&rrot;nede þis ȝeo&rrot;dene sone &punctelev; into pu&ydot;r gold and cler
And þe &slong;tones to ȝimmes p&rrot;eciouse &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝh o&rrot;e louerdes pouwer
And þis twei wilde Bachilers bachilersr
&punctelev; he ȝaf it euerech del
Herewith he seide ȝe mouwen &punctelev; habbe wel manie guode Mel mel
And also muche lond eou bugge aȝein &punctelev; and mo&rrot;e þane ȝe solden bifo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; ȝe habbuth bote ȝe betere do &punctelev; þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene furlo&rrot;e
¶Þis ȝongue Men men nomen þis tresour &punctelev; and wel glade þarof were
And to manie goldsmiþes &punctelev; wel wideabouten it bere
Þis goldsmiþes swo&rrot;en euerechon &punctelev; þat þis gold iseiȝen
Þat so clene gold ne so pu&ydot;r &punctelev; hu&ydot; ne seiȝen neuere with eiȝen
¶Hou miȝte fairo&rrot;e miracle beo &punctelev; oþur fairo&rrot;e poer
Þat[al. þen] bowes and ȝeo&rrot;dene to&rrot;nede þare &punctelev; in so pu&ydot;r gold and cler
¶Also seint Iohan þe Ewangeli&slong;t &punctelev; ferro&rrot;e wende þere
And þe twe&ydot; men fo&rrot;th with him &punctelev; þat so riche of golde were[This v. on the margin.]
A ded man toward burijngue &punctelev; Men men b&rrot;ouȝhten ope one bere
Þe Moder moder criede opon sein Iohan &punctelev; þat he him scholde arere
Louerd heo seide ich bidde þe &punctelev; þat þou habbe reuþe of me
And of mi sone þat is ded &punctelev; ib&rrot;ouȝt here aȝein þe
haue reuþe of him ich bidde þe &punctelev; fo&rrot; Iesues woundes fiue
Ase þou hadde&slong;t of Drusiane &punctelev; þo þou arerde&slong;t hire to liue
¶Þo gan seint Iohan to weope so&rrot;e &punctelev; and bad a&slong;tunte þe bere
And bad o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; is grace &punctelev; þat dede bodi arere
Þis ȝongue man anon with þis wo&rrot;d &punctelev; to liue aros þere
Þo was Io&ydot;e ioye and blisse inouȝh &punctelev; among alle þat þare were
¶Ich hote þe nouþe quath seint Iohan &punctelev; "þat ded ha&slong;t ibeo ȝare
Þat þou telle þis men sumþing &punctelev; of þat þou seiȝe ellesȝware
And nameliche here to þis twei men &punctelev; þat nouþe beoth fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e
Þat beoth ito&rrot;nede to þe deuele aȝein &punctelev; to ȝwam hu&ydot; serueden bifo&rrot;e
¶Þis ȝongue Man man þat was to liue arerd &punctelev; biheold þeos oþure tweiȝe
Allas he seide þe wrechhede &punctelev; þat ich iseo bi eou beiȝe
Þulke time þat ȝe fo&rrot;soken &punctelev; þis holie Mannes mannes lo&rrot;e
Aungles þat eou wu&slong;ten er &punctelev; weopen fo&rrot; eou ful so&rrot;e
And ȝu&ydot;t hu&ydot; doth ase ich nou riȝht iseiȝh &punctelev; and þe deuelene in heo&rrot;e ende
¶Mauden fo&rrot; eou Io&ydot;e ioye inouȝh &punctelev; to ȝwam ȝe gonne wiende
Allas wrechches þe muchele pine &punctelev; þat to eou is alȝare
Þat in helle ich saiȝh to eouwer bihoffþe &punctelev; to ȝwan ȝe schullen fare
Þo þis twei Men men iheo&rrot;den þis &punctelev; hu&ydot; bigonne to crie anon
Deol and seo&rrot;uwe hu&ydot; mauden inouȝh &punctelev; and gradden opon seint Iohan
Allas ȝe foles[ȝe f. overlined.] quath seint Iohan &punctelev; ȝe nuteth ȝware ȝe wollez beo
Ȝif god God wolle habbe merci of eou &punctelev; ȝe mouwen sone iseo
To ech sunful man he is redi &punctelev; þat to him wole iwiende
Þarefo&rrot;e criez ȝeo&rrot;ne on him &punctelev; fo&rrot;to he eou milce siende
And þe soþe ȝe mouwen sone underȝite &punctelev; ȝwane he hath eou milce isent
Ȝwane þis gold and þeos ȝimmes &punctelev; to heo&rrot;e ku&ydot;nde beoth aȝen iwent
¶Hu&ydot; crieden ȝeo&rrot;ne on o&rrot;e louerd þo &punctelev; and in penaunce hu&ydot; were
In fa&slong;tingue and in o&rrot;esones &punctelev; þritti dawes þere
Þo tur[n]de þat gold bifo&rrot;e heo&rrot;e eiȝene &punctelev; into bowes of treo
And þe ȝ&ydot;mmes into harde &slong;tones &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; hadden er ibeo
¶Þo þis ȝongue men þis iseiȝen &punctelev; glade hu&ydot; weren inouȝh
Þudere aȝein ase hu&ydot; fetten heom er &punctelev; hu&ydot; beren euerech bouȝh
And fo&rrot;soken al þe wo&rrot;ldes p&rrot;u&ydot;te &punctelev; and duden ase þe wise
And endeden heo&rrot;e lif atþe la&slong;te &punctelev; in o&rrot;e louerdes seruise
[Perd&rrot;ix.]¶In a time ase þis holie man &punctelev; wende in þe contre&ydot;e
A ȝong partrich he bar on his hond &punctelev; and þarewith he gan ple&ydot;e
A w&ydot;lde louerd&ydot;ng þare cam gon &punctelev; aȝein him bi þe we&ydot;e
Iwepned swiþe baldeliche &punctelev; he nadde of no man E&ydot;ȝe e&ydot;ȝe
Ab&ydot;semare he biheold seint Iohan &punctelev; þo he him saiȝh bere on honde
Þis ȝongue foul and þarewith ple&ydot;e &punctelev; þareto he hadde onde
Loke he seide þis olde conIoun conioun &punctelev; in his olde liue
Þat men holdez swuch p&rrot;ophete &punctelev; alle oþur men to schriue
wel bitrufleth he þat folk &punctelev; here men miȝhten iseo
hou he pleiȝez with þis ȝongue b&rrot;id &punctelev; he ne miȝhte nouȝt w&ydot;s beo
¶Leoue b&rrot;oþur quath seint Iohan &punctelev; ich bidde tel þou me
Ȝwat is þat þou bere&slong;t on honde &punctelev; and ȝwareoffe it seruez þe
Ane bouwe ich bere quath þis oþur &punctelev; and Arewen also þerto
To scheoten wilde be&slong;tes with &punctelev; and wilde foules also
¶Biend þine bouwe quath seint Ioan &punctelev; to loke ȝwat he can do
Þis ȝongue Man man nam and bende is bouwe &punctelev; and bar it longue so
Þareaftur sone he nam is bouwe &punctelev; and unbende it ase he couþe
Ȝw&ydot; do&slong;t þou so" quath sein Iohan &punctelev; ȝwat schal he vnbend nouþe
Fo&rrot; he wole quath þis oþur &punctelev; þe smarto&rrot;e d&rrot;&ydot;ue eftsone
And þe betere dunt ȝ&ydot;ue to euerech þing &punctelev; þat ich habbe with to done
¶Fo&rrot; ȝif ich hire bere longue ibend &punctelev; þe feblo&rrot;e heo wolle beo
And euerech d&rrot;auȝht þe wo&rrot;se d&rrot;iue &punctelev; þat ma&ydot; ech man[MS. man ma&ydot;] iwite and seo
Leoue b&rrot;oþur quath seint Iohan &punctelev; also it farez iwis
Bi mannes heo&rrot;te here on eo&rrot;þe &punctelev; þat feble and leoþi is
Ȝif he is toward Iusu Iesu
cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; ibend fa&slong;te eueremo
Febli he schal and beo asad &punctelev; and is &slong;trencþe also ago
And ȝif he is oþurȝwile onbend &punctelev; and ito&rrot;ned to solaz
he wole bieon eftsone ȝwane he is ibend &punctelev; &slong;tifo&rrot;e þane he er was
And in gode&slong; Godes seruise þe bet d&rrot;iue & du&ydot;re &punctelev; and þareto beon &slong;tif and &slong;trong
Þarefo&rrot;e mot ech holi man &punctelev; solaci him among
And tu&ydot;rne is herte to some tru&ydot;fle &punctelev; ȝwane he ma&ydot; ani ise
Þat he mouwe to gode&slong; Godes seruise &punctelev; þe &slong;tifo&rrot;e and þe &slong;trengo&rrot;e be.[This v. on the margin.]
Þe Ern ern is foul of alle foules &punctelev; þat he&ydot;ȝe&slong;t ma&ydot; fleo
And ȝu&ydot;t he mot nede to re&slong;ten him &punctelev; aȝein to grounde teo
hou miȝhte he euere fleon on heiȝh &punctelev; bote he re&slong;te him atþe grounde
Nammo&rrot;e ne ma&ydot; mannes bodi &punctelev; bote he re&slong;te him sum &slong;tounde
Þarefo&rrot;e bel am&ydot; þou miȝht &punctelev; herebi þat soþe[MS. þe soþe herebi þat soþe.] ise
Þat fo&rrot; solaz man ma&ydot; þe betere &punctelev; in gode&slong; Godes seruise be
¶Seint Iohan wende aboute wide &punctelev; and churche he liet arere
And maude p&rrot;eo&slong;tes and bischopes &punctelev; þat folk fo&rrot;to lere
Ake Ari&slong;tod[i]mus þe bischop &punctelev; þat he to&rrot;nede er to cri&slong;tindom
In þe Cite cite of Ephese &punctelev; swiþe holi man bicam
And ane churche of seint Iohan &punctelev; in Ephese he arerde bliue
And seint Iohan sethþe in þulke churche &punctelev; wende out of þis liue
¶A da&ydot; ase þis holie man &punctelev; his seruise hadde ido
A ȝoung man he sa&ydot; þarebiside &punctelev; &slong;talewo&rrot;þe and fair also
Ake a liȝht red he was and of þunne wit. &punctelev; seint Iohan biheold him fa&slong;te
And opon a bischop þarebiside &punctelev; his eiȝene anon he ca&slong;te
Ich bitake þe he seide in warde to wite &punctelev; þis man here lo
Þat þou him loke and no&rrot;ichi wel &punctelev; þat he nouȝt ne misdo
So þat þou me ansuerie of is warde &punctelev; ȝwane þou me come&slong;t eft to
witnesse ich take on ihesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; and on holie churche also
¶Sire wel fawe þe bischop seide &punctelev; þis ȝongueman he tok wel softe
Seint Iohan him chargede of is warde &punctelev; and muneguede him wel ofte
Þat he him wu&slong;te swiþe wel &punctelev; ase he answerie wolde
And biteiȝhte heom boþe Ihesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; and wende ȝwodere he scholde
Þis bischop nam þis Ioliue man &punctelev; and ladde hom to is inne
And no&rrot;ichcede him softe and wel &punctelev; seint Iones loue to winne
And p&rrot;echede him ȝeo&rrot;ne of Ihesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; to binimen him his folie
So þat þis ȝoungue man to guode turnde &punctelev; and merci gan to crie
And faire bar him and louede wel &punctelev; god God and seinte marie Marie
And dude al þat þe bischop wolde &punctelev; and guod lif gan d&rrot;iȝe
¶Atþe la&slong;te þis bischop &punctelev; sumdel is heo&rrot;te gan wiende
Ase ofte verlich bigu&ydot;nninge &punctelev; flechchez atþen ende
he soffrede þis ȝonge man to ple&ydot;e &punctelev; ant to muche habbe is wille
And lu&ydot;te and lu&ydot;te don folie &punctelev; and liet him al aspille
Fo&rrot;me&slong;t he gan haunti wakes &punctelev; and fo&rrot; compa&ydot;gnie
he wax a s&ydot;uto&rrot; of tauernes &punctelev; and siwede to glotonie
Þo ne miȝhte he nouȝht beon withoute &punctelev; and turnde to lecherie
And bicam an holer &slong;trong &punctelev; and to&rrot;nede alto folie
¶So longue to holden up his folie &punctelev; smale þingues he nam
Aftur þe smale he tok þe grete &punctelev; and &slong;trong þef he bicam
So þat he hadde gret dede&ydot;n &punctelev; smale þefþes to do
Fo&rrot; bote it were þe gretto&rrot;e þing &punctelev; he ne to&rrot;nede nouȝht þerto
Atþe la&slong;te to þe compa&ydot;gnie of Outlawes outlawes &punctelev; sone he gan gon
Vnder non oþur he nolde beon &punctelev; ake hext mai&slong;ter anon
Oþure þat ero&rrot;e mai&slong;tres weren &punctelev; bicomen is men echon
he robbede oueral to grounde &punctelev; and slowȝh[o&rrot;ig. slowen] also mani on
Mo&rrot;e so&rrot;uwe ne miȝhte beo &punctelev; þane he dude in eche ende
Fo&rrot; of[te][MS. of] vuel cha&slong;tingue &punctelev; to folie wolie[al. wole] wiende
¶So þat seint Iohan in a time &punctelev; to þat Bischop bischop cam
Aftur ȝwam he bitok him er in warde &punctelev; guode ȝeme aboute he nam
Sire bischop he seide ȝeld me up &punctelev; þat guode treso&rrot; ich rede
Þat in warde ich þe bitok &punctelev; and acountes of is dede
¶Þo was þe bischop so&rrot;e ad&rrot;ad &punctelev; sire merci he seide
Ine ma&ydot; him þe ȝelde nouȝht &punctelev; fo&rrot; he is ded ich d&rrot;ed[e]
Alas quath sein Iohan ȝweþur he beo &punctelev; in ȝwat manere is þis
Certes sire þe bischop seide aȝein god God ded he is
his soule is ded þei is bodi &punctelev; ȝu&ydot;t aliue beo
Fo&rrot; he is outlawe &slong;trong bicome &punctelev; ase al þe contre&ydot;e ma&ydot; seo
Opon an heiȝh hul he wonez &punctelev; with outlawes mani on
And lat aquelle and robi also &punctelev; alle þat he ma&ydot; ofgon
¶Þo bigan þis holi man &punctelev; to sike and weope so&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; deol is cloþus he tod&rrot;ouȝ &punctelev; louerd he seide þin o&rrot;e
Ane feble treso&rrot;er ich me ches &punctelev; and þo&rrot;uȝh is feble lo&rrot;e
Mi deo&rrot;ewu&ydot;rþe tresur ich habbe [ilo&rrot;e]! &punctelev; ine tru&slong;te to him nonmo&rrot;e
Alas sire bischop þi feble warde &punctelev; ine þonki þe nouȝht þarcfo&rrot;e
Ȝwane it non oþur nis ich mot seche &punctelev; þat þou me ha&slong;t ilo&rrot;e
¶Lat gre&ydot;þi me an ho&rrot;s anon &punctelev; and ane man in ane &slong;tounde
Þat he[al. om.] me mouwe þane we&ydot; teche &punctelev; fo&rrot;to ich him habbe ifounde
Þis holie man þat feble was &punctelev; and ouercome neiȝh with elde
Opon a &slong;trong ho&rrot;s he Arnde arnde fo&rrot;th &punctelev; ouer mo&rrot; and ouer felde
So þat þare þe outlawes weren &punctelev; he cam atþe la&slong;te
And some of þe schrewes weren alȝare &punctelev; and nomen him wel fa&slong;te
To robbi him and to sle &punctelev; and heten him holde him &slong;tille
Ov beau freres quath seint Ioan &punctelev; ich mot nede don ouwer wille
¶Ake ich bidde eou fo&rrot; eouwer co&rrot;tesie &punctelev; eouwer ma&ydot;&slong;ter latez [me] seo
And latez himsulf with me do &punctelev; ȝwat is wille beo
Wel iArmed iarmed þe mai&slong;ter cam &punctelev; p&rrot;ikie and ride fa&slong;te
And ano[n] so he on þis holie man &punctelev; his eiȝene afeo&rrot; ca&slong;te
And wu&slong;te wel þat he it was &punctelev; him gan to schamie so so&rrot;e
Þat he bigan to fleo anon &punctelev; and ne kepte iseo him nonmo&rrot;e
¶Anon so sein Ioan þis iseiȝh &punctelev; he Arnde arnde aftur anon
And siwede him also &slong;tifliche[al. [h]a&slong;teliche r. ha&slong;tifliche] &punctelev; ase his ho&rrot;s miȝhte gon
he Arnde ase þei he a ȝung man were. &punctelev; mi sone he seide þi o&rrot;e
Ȝw&ydot; fleu&slong;tþou me nam ich þi fader? &punctelev; ne d&rrot;ed þe nouȝt so so&rrot;e
Spek here with þi feble fader &punctelev; vnArmed vnarmed and in elde
Abid me nouþe and ichulle fo&rrot; þe &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd resun ȝelde
Ich am ȝare þene deth afongue &punctelev; fo&rrot; þine &slong;trongue pine[A v. om.: As our louerd dude fo&rrot; us &punctelev; & mi soule ȝiue fo&rrot; þine.]
Spek with me bote þou mo&rrot;e wolle &punctelev; ich hote a gode&slong; Godes name
Þe oþur a&slong;tunte and vnneþe abod &punctelev; he ne miȝhte no[n] oþur fo&rrot; schame
¶He aliȝhte and vnarmede him &punctelev; and weopinde ful so&rrot;e
he ful to seint Iones fet &punctelev; and cride him milce and o&rrot;e
And bihiet him &slong;tifliche a gode&slong; Godes name &punctelev; þat he nold [misdo] namo&rrot;e
Ake louien god God and holi churche &punctelev; and libbe al bi is lo&rrot;e
So þat he was euereft mo&rrot;e &punctelev; guod man and &slong;table inouȝ
And bi seint Iones rede ladde is lif &punctelev; and to alle guodnesse he d&rrot;ouȝ
¶Seint [Iohan] leouede here so longue &punctelev; and so mani his dawes were
Þat he ne miȝhte nouȝht ouer þe eo&rrot;þe go &punctelev; bote ase is desciples him bere
hu&ydot; beren him fo&rrot; feblesse and fo&rrot; elde &punctelev; to churche with alle teone
And eueremo&rrot;e he p&rrot;echede hem &punctelev; þat loue heom were bitweone
Þo he was of an hond&rrot;ed ȝer &punctelev; bote o ȝer wane vnneþe
And seuene and sixti ȝer it was &punctelev; aftur o&rrot;e louerdes deþe
¶Ore louerd with is desciples cam to him &punctelev; fram heouene up an heiȝh
Cum fo&rrot;th he seide mi frend to me &punctelev; þi time is comen neiȝh
hit is neiȝh time þat þou come &punctelev; to mine riche fe&slong;te
with þine b&rrot;eþren in mine riche &punctelev; fo&rrot; it schal euere ile&slong;te
Fo&rrot; þou schalt nouþe asonenda&ydot; &punctelev; þat þene fifte da&ydot; heonne is
Þe da&ydot; of mine op&rrot;isingue &punctelev; to me comen iwis
¶Þis holie man hiet his desciples &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; him to churche bere
Þat of him and in his name &punctelev; Ari&slong;todinus Ari&slong;todimus liet arere
Þat folk cam sone þicke þudere &punctelev; with deol and so&rrot; inouȝh
Fo&rrot; hit was couth swiþe sone &punctelev; þat he toward is ende d&rrot;ouȝh
¶Þene sonenn&ydot;ȝht wel t&ydot;me &punctelev; his seruise he gan to do
And sethþe he gan þat folk to wisse &punctelev; and to p&rrot;echi also
Atþe fur&slong;te cocke þat creuȝ &punctelev; he gan to p&rrot;echie fa&slong;te
And fo&rrot;to heiȝh vnderne of þe da&ydot;e &punctelev; his p&rrot;echingue ila&slong;te
Þo hiet he is desciples þat hu&ydot; ane put &punctelev; fourhu&ydot;rned him made
Fa&slong;te biside þe heiȝe weuede &punctelev; with schouelene and with spade
And þat hu&ydot; ca&slong;ten out at þe churchedo&rrot;e &punctelev; þe eo&rrot;þe ȝeo&rrot;ne he bad
With weop and with so&rrot;uwe inouȝh &punctelev; þe put was þare imad
¶Þo þe put was alȝare imaud &punctelev; In in alle heo&rrot;e e&ydot;ȝene siȝhte
Þis holie man wel softeliche &punctelev; þudere in gan aliȝhte
his hondene he huld up on heiȝh &punctelev; swete louerd he seide
Ich am cominde to þine fe&slong;te &punctelev; ase þou me ero&rrot;e bede
¶Louerd muche ich þonki þe &punctelev; þat it þi wille is
To þine gi&slong;tningue cleopie [me] &punctelev; fo&rrot; muche ich it wilni iwis
Þine sones ich bitake [þe] to loke &punctelev; ȝwane ine ma&ydot; no lengo&rrot;e heom wite
Þat holie churche þine clene spouse &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ me þe hath biȝite
Vnderfong me with mine b&rrot;eþren &punctelev; þat þou b&rrot;ouȝhte&slong;t with þe
Þo þou me bede to þine holie fe&slong;te &punctelev; and come aftur me
¶Þo cam þare aboute þis holie man &punctelev; so muche liȝht aliȝthe
Þat no man ne miȝhte fo&rrot; cler leome &punctelev; habbe of him no siȝhte
Þis holie man him blessede &punctelev; and wel softe adoun he la&ydot;
Mine b&rrot;eþren he seide iblessede ȝe beon &punctelev; and habbez nouþe guod da&ydot;
¶Þis guode man wende out of þis wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; alclene withoute ech pine
Ase he was clene in ma&ydot;denhod &punctelev; he cam to a swete fine
Þat clere liȝht þat aboute him was &punctelev; la&slong;te alme&slong;t ane t&ydot;de
Þat folk ne seiȝen nouȝt of him &punctelev; fa&slong;te hu&ydot; weopen and cride
Þo þis liȝth apassed was &punctelev; hu&ydot; [lokede] in þe put to grounde
Þareinne of þis holie Man man &punctelev; noþing hu&ydot; ne seiȝen ne founde
Þare nas inne nouȝht bote smale gre&ydot;nes &punctelev; þat heo miȝhten vnderȝite
Þat is holi þing and is icleoped &punctelev; Manna manna in holi write
Þat o&rrot;e louerd wole in fourme of re&ydot;n &punctelev; fram heouene to vrþe sende
Þe child&rrot;en of Israhel to heo&rrot;e mete &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; of[MS. to] Eg&ydot;pte wenden
¶Þis Manna manna þat holie gre&ydot;n &punctelev; ȝu&ydot;t to þis da&ydot; dez sp&rrot;ingue
Op of þat put þat manie men &punctelev; b&rrot;inguez to botningue
Non oþur þing of seint Iohan &punctelev; men ne miȝhten on eo&rrot;þe finde
Alclene ich wene in heouene he is &punctelev; þare nis no leome bihinde
Of euerech haluwe men founden fo&rrot;soþe &punctelev; þat bodi bileue here
Bote of o&rrot;e laued&ydot; and of him &punctelev; þat ma&ydot;denes weren so clere
Fa&ydot;r a þing is Maidenhod maidenhod &punctelev; ase it is on heom isene
In þis Manere manere seint Iohan wende &punctelev; of þis eo&rrot;thþelich lif ich wene
¶Seint Edward þat was nouþe late &punctelev; In in
enguelonde Enguelonde o&rrot;e king
Þis holie seint Iohan þe Ewangeli&slong;t &punctelev; he louede þo&rrot;uȝh alle þing
Men ne scholde him noþing bidde &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe loue of seint Iohan
Þat he miȝhte do withoute blame &punctelev; þat he ne grauntede anon
A da&ydot; þare cam a pouere man &punctelev; with ful d&rrot;eo&rrot;i mod
And bad him fo&rrot; seint Iohanes loue &punctelev; þat he ȝeue him sum guod
¶Seint Edward him biþouȝhte &punctelev; þo he ne hadde þare noþing
Fo&rrot;to ȝ&ydot;ue þis pouere Man man &punctelev; bote ane gu&ydot;ldene ring
Þane r&ydot;ng he louede wel inouȝ &punctelev; and fo&rrot; þe loue of seint Iohan
Ȝu&ydot;[t] he hine ȝaf þe pouere manne &punctelev; and he wende him fo&rrot;th anon
¶Þareaftur sethþe seint Iohan cam &punctelev; to a kn&ydot;ȝht of Enguelonde
Ase he was biȝeonde se &punctelev; Auntres auntres fo&rrot;to fonde
Wiend he seide ȝwane þou hom come&slong;t &punctelev; to Edward eower king
And seiȝe þat he fo&rrot; ȝwas loue &punctelev; he ȝaf þeosne r&ydot;ng
Sende him here his r&ydot;ng aȝe&ydot;n &punctelev; and þonki him also
Þo þis kn&ydot;ȝht cam to enguelonde &punctelev; his erinde he gan do
¶Seint Edward ikneuȝh wel þane ring &punctelev; and þarebi onder&slong;tod anon
Þat þe pouere man þat he him ȝaf &punctelev; was þe guode seint Iohan.[Harl. adds:]
Nouþe seint Iohan þe Ewangeli&slong;t &punctelev; ȝ&ydot;f it þi wille is
Beode o&rrot;e Erinde erinde þat we moten &punctelev; come to heouene blis AMEN
Þulke ring is ȝut at we&slong;tm&ydot;n&slong;tre &punctelev; fo&rrot; relik ido
As me scheweþ pelegrims &punctelev; þat ofte comeþ þerto
